note.p: Burial: The family vault in Arno's Vale cemetery, Bristol, Gloucestershire
Education: University College School, London; Edinburgh. MD (1862).

Career: Went to England (aged 14); Physician, Royal Edinburgh Hospital for Sick Children (c1871); Lecturer in Physiology, Surgeon's Hall, Edinburgh (c1871); Assistant to the Professor of Medical Jusrisprudence, Edinburgh University (1871); Professor of Physiology, Owen's College, Manchester (1873-1885); resigned and set up practice in St Leonard's-on Sea, Sussex (1885); Assistant Physician, St George's Hospital, London (1887-1889); worked in Cambridge, then lived and practised in Berne, Lausanne and Montreux; visited America (1902 and 1903); died of pneumonia
